questions.question_text:
You have Microsoft Teams Phone handsets.

You need to receive an alert when a handset of an executive goes offline.

What should you do in the Microsoft Team admin center?

choices.B: Create a configuration profile for IP phones.
choices.A: Create a Teams app setup policy and assign the policy to all executives.
choices.C: Register the handsets by using remote provisioning.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams deployment.

You notice that users erroneously create a live event when attempting to create a meeting from the Teams client calendar.

You need to disable live events for all users.

What should you modify from the Microsoft Teams admin center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
correct - testet in TAC

questions.question_text:
Your company has an office in Adelaide.

The company has a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You acquire a new service number that has the local Adelaide area code.

You need to update the default conferencing toll number for only the users in the Adelaide office.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.E: Modify the Assigned phone number setting for each Adelaide office user.
choices.F: Modify the global (Org-wide default) audio conferencing policy.
choices.C: Assign the number to a resource account.
choices.B: Assign the policy to the Adelaide office users.

discussion.content: I'm not 100% sure on this, but since end to end encryption is enabled and locked, I believe that will prevent the ability for anyone to record the meetings, therefore the answers are: Users from untrusted organizations, and No one is

Seems correct. For the second option, see below:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/create-custom-meeting-template#recording--transcription
Who can record: Specifies whether meetings can be recorded by organizers and co-organizers only or by organizers, co-organizers, and presenters.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.

You configure a meeting template as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

Users currently provide a five-digit PIN number to dial in to a meeting.

You need to change the PIN length to require users to enter a seven-digit PIN number.

What should you configure from the Microsoft Teams admin center?

discussion.content:
C is the correct answer - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-the-pin-length-for-audio-conferencing-meetings-in-teams

Tested it in TAC as well. Didn't know that bridge settings existed.
